snippet: Democrats tried to add a provision that would prohibit airlines from setting unreasonable fees, but it failed on a party-line tie vote.
abstract: Senate Commerce Committee approves bill to continue Federal Aviation Admin's authority to operate through Oct 1, 2017; does not pass provision that would have prevented airlines from setting unreasonable fees.
lead_paragraph: Democrats tried to add a provision that would prohibit airlines from setting unreasonable fees, but it failed on a party-line tie vote.

headline.main: Senate Panel Backs F.A.A. Authority, but Not Curb on Fees
headline.print_headline: Senate Panel Backs F.A.A. Authority, but Not Curb on Fees
